body_html:
I'm not sure that I understand. The data loading result today is already deterministic even when num_workers > 0. The base_seed is generated using the PyTorch random seed, which you may set before data loading.

Furthermore, your base_seed = torch.LongTensor(1).random_(seed)[0] will just generate same seed in every worker.
body_text:
I'm not sure that I understand. The data loading result today is already deterministic even when num_workers > 0. The base_seed is generated using the PyTorch random seed, which you may set before data loading.
Furthermore, your base_seed = torch.LongTensor(1).random_(seed)[0] will just generate same seed in every worker.
body:
I'm not sure that I understand. The data loading result today is already deterministic even when `num_workers > 0`. The `base_seed` is generated using the PyTorch random seed, which you may set before data loading.

Furthermore, your `base_seed = torch.LongTensor(1).random_(seed)[0]` will just generate same seed in every worker.
